metadata.Title: CVE-2023-41358 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in FRRouting FRR through 9.0. bgpd/bgp_packet.cprocesses NLRIs if the attribute length is zero.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-41358` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

quagga - 1.2.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
quagga-bgpd - 1.2.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
quagga-core - 1.2.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
quagga-isisd - 1.2.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
quagga-ospf6d - 1.2.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
quagga-ospfd - 1.2.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
quagga-pimd - 1.2.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
quagga-ripd - 1.2.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
quagga-ripngd - 1.2.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: quagga package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
